-KcOAEcqW_WTDOYTUagm.about:
GENERATE YOUR ELECTRICITY
Everyone has the potential to succeed, in electrical domain it is measured in volts. Check your voltage in HIGH VOLTAGE CONCEPTS (HVC).
Be it the millions of kilowatt hours of electricity consumed by RASHTRAPATI BHAVAN or the 40 watts you consume for every hour on Facebook; electricity today is a basic necessity.
With new challenges faced everyday by electrical engineers today, they have to show innovations.
Keeping this in mind OJASS brings to you HIGH VOLTAGE CONCEPTS.

Round1-
Round 1 will be written based, on the basic concepts of electrical engineering and its practical applications. Questions shall differ for students of different years so that selection can be fair.
Round2: On the basis of performance in round 1, top students will be taken on a field trip to TATA POWER where they will be shown how a power plant functions and what steps are taken to ensure smooth running. Round3:Selected students from round 2 will have to face a GROUP DISCUSSION. This is not a elimination round.
Round4:15 students who qualify round 3 will face an interview by the recruiters of TATA POWER. The final result will be decided on cumulative basis from the scores of all rounds by respective judges.

-KcQUPfaZLm5nr0jTT6q.about:
Dota is a competitive game of action and strategy, played both professionally and casually by millions of passionate fans worldwide. Players pick from a pool of over a hundred heroes, forming two teams of five players. Radiant heroes then battle their Dire counterparts to control a gorgeous fantasy landscape, waging campaigns of cunning, stealth, and outright warfare.
Irresistibly colorful on the surface, Dota is a game of infinite depth and complexity. Every hero has an array of skills and abilities that combine with the skills of their allies in unexpected ways, to ensure that no game is ever remotely alike. This is one of the reasons that the Dota phenomenon has continued to grow. Originating as a fan-made Warcraft 3 modification, Dota was an instant underground hit. After coming to Valve, the original community developers have bridged the gap to a more inclusive audience, so that the rest of the world can experience the same core gameplay, but with the level of polish that only Valve can provide.
Get a taste of the game that has enthralled millions.
-KcQUPfaZLm5nr0jTT6q.detail:
WILD CARD

- Four team double elimination.
- All matches are Best of 3.
- Winner of Upper Bracket becomes Wild Card #1 in Group Stage, winner of lower bracket becomes Wild Card #2.

Selection Priority for game one is determined by a coin toss. Alternates for game two. Coin toss is used again if there is a third game.
The team with Selection Priority may pick either their side of the map or the drafting order.
Brackets will be decided randomly.

GROUP STAGE

- Two groups of eight teams
- Each match consists of two games against the same opponent
- A 2-0 win provides 3 points, 1-1 provides 1 point, and 0-2 provides 0 points.

In each match, a coin toss decides which team has Selection Priority. Alternates for game two.

Tiebreakers

- If there is a tie along the Upper and Lower Bracket divider, more games will be played.
- For other games, the following is used:

1- Compare the matchup history of the tied teams
2- Compare their wins vs the seed right below them. Repeat until resolved
3- Coin toss

MAIN EVENT

The 1st place in each group of Group Stage picks their opponent from either the 3rd or 4th place finish in the opposite group.
Upper Bracket:

Upper Bracket A: Group A Seed 1 vs Group B Seed 3/4
Upper Bracket B: Group B Seed 2 vs Group A Seed 3/4 (The team Group B Seed 1 didn't choose)
Upper Bracket C: Group B Seed 1 vs Group A Seed 3/4
Upper Bracket D: Group A Seed 2 vs Group B Seed 3/4 (The team Group A Seed 1 didn't choose)

First Round: The higher seed has Selection Priority for game 1 and 3.
Other Rounds: Selection Priority for game one is determined by coin toss. Alternates for game two. Coin toss is used again if there is a third game.
All Upper Bracket games are Best of 3. Grand Final is Best of 5, no game advantage.

Lower Bracket

Lower Bracket A: Group A Seed 5vs Group B Seed 7/8
Lower Bracket B: Group B Seed 6 vs Group A Seed 7/8 (The team Group B Seed 5 didn't choose)
Lower Bracket C: Group B Seed 5 vs Group A Seed 7/8
Lower Bracket D: Group A Seed 6 vs Group B Seed 7/8 (The team Group A Seed 5 didn't choose)

First Round: The higher seed has Selection Priority in the Best of 1.
Other Rounds: Selection Priority for game one is determined by coin toss. Alternates for game two. Coin toss is used again if there is a third game.

Lower Bracket matches are Best of 3, except for the first round which is Best of 1..
-KcQUPfaZLm5nr0jTT6q.name: Dota

-KcQVnYXGbY-tIqNT80h.about: There's a moment an hour or two after you start Need For Speed: Most Wanted when everything seems to click into place. Before this happens, you'll be constantly slamming into walls and oncoming traffic, wondering how you'll ever manage to escape cops that drive tricked-out Corvettes, and unsure if the cars you're racing against consist of anything other than tail lights, objective evidence to the contrary not being easy to come across. But then, you find a car you like, you nab a few hard-earned upgrades, and you finally manage to get the hang of the game's sensitive drifting mechanism. If you can manage not to destroy your controller before you reach this meeting point of skill and experience, you'll be able to take in Most Wanted for what it is: a very engaging, if not ground-breaking, open-world racer.“Need for Speed Most Wanted offers players an expansive open world packed with exhilarating action where they can choose their own path to become the Most Wanted”.

-KcT5RyDG4SZEYh9DE-W.about: It’s so strong, it does not break,It’s so powerful, it penetrates a lake,Sometimes it’s weak as a twig left out in the sun, It’s so wonderful it gives us the power to have fun.Diddle diddle, solve the riddle…well, got entangled??Riddles are fun,You come we’ll play,But don’t get shocked,It’s all your forte.Ojass’18 presents an igniting opportunity for you all to showcase your electronomics and apply analogics to let the impulses fire in your brain and rewire your thoughts. -KcT5RyDG4SZEYh9DE-W.detail:
This event consists of two rounds.

Round-1:

This will be a written round and will also be a qualifying round for the subsequent round. Questions will be in the form of one word answers, crosswords, fill in the blanks and circuit guesses. After this round, twelve teams will be selected six from 1st year and six from 2nd year.

Round-2:

This round will consist of a breadboard circuit identification and analysis round and an audio-visual buzzer round. In the former, the given circuit on a breadboard has to be identified and its working has to be explained briefly and in the latter round which will be a buzzer round, based on the audios and videos provided riddles have to be solved.

Questions for both the rounds will be based on the various components used in circuits and other fundamentals of electrical and electronics. Questions will differ for students of different years for unbiased selection.

-KcTGptq6R0yIy72Nsuk.about:
Artifact is the representation of “An art moulded by facts”. It is always fascinating to know about the processes involved in the making of objects which we see and use every day and yet take them for granted. These processes and the sequence in which they are performed give an object its uniqueness.ARTIFACT gives you the opportunity to prove your cognizance of and expertise in manufacturing field.You just need to delve into your brain and answer the question-
HOW IS IT MADE?
-KcTGptq6R0yIy72Nsuk.detail:
This event will be held in three rounds.
Round 1: Aptitude Round
This is an objective round.
All the questions will be from general aptitude.
The time duration for this round will be 25 minutes and it will comprise of 40 questions. For each correct answer, 3 marks will be rewarded whereas for each incorrect answer, 1 mark will be deducted. An unanswered question gets no marks.
Mode of test: Pen and paper
Mobile phones, calculators or any other electronic gadgets will not be allowed for this round.
Round 2: Technical and General Awareness Round
The questions will judge your basic general awareness and technical knowledge. Subjects included will be thermodynamics, strength of material and manufacturing processes etc.
The time duration for this round will be 30 minutes and it will comprise of 30 questions. For each correct answer, 3 marks will be rewarded whereas for each incorrect answer, 1 mark will be deducted. An unanswered question gets no marks.
Mode of test: Pen and paper
Calculators are allowed. Mobile phones or any other electronic gadgets will not be allowed for this round.
Round 3: How is it made?
This is an interactive round. Only the groups qualifying Round 2 will be eligible.
Several items which are used or seen in everyday life will be displayed to various groups and questions related to the materials used and processes involved in their manufacturing will be asked.
Marking scheme will depend upon the questions asked and will be disclosed at the start of the round.
The final decision on the acceptability of the answer will rest with the coordinators of the event.
-KcTGptq6R0yIy72Nsuk.name: Artifact

-KchaB1wsmEZ6iGIeRmd.about: Terrorists have overrun a laboratory, where confidential experiments are underway. The terrorists have taken senior personnel as hostages whose imminent contributions are of strategic importance. The laboratory houses sophisticated, critical equipment that have taken years to build. Terrorists have threatened to blow up the laboratory with all that it contains with bomb.  The commander of the area is to take defensive and offensive action. Before planning a raid on the laboratory he wants to take stock of the situation outside & inside the laboratory and is looking to the teams to provide him with critical information.
-KchaB1wsmEZ6iGIeRmd.detail:
"This is a virtual event and everything mentioned below has to be done on papers and only the design report has to be submitted. Actual working model of UAV is not required for the event.The “situation identification” mission for the teams is to launch RC-UAV from an area at a safe distance (500m approx) from the laboratory. There is no line of visual sight from launch area to the laboratory. Team must assess the situation outside and inside the laboratory without being slighted by the terrorist and report to the commander in real time. Crucial information required for the commander to carry out the rescue operation includes:
• Safe approach route to the laboratory (marked as arch)
• Monitoring and avoiding the terrorist while entering the laboratory
• Internal details in the laboratory
1. Number of terrorist, hostages inside
2. Explosive threats & weapons
3. Critical equipments.
After getting the information the MICAVs may return to the launch area.
The Infrastructure Laboratory The laboratory would be a temporary structure 18.3 m (60 ft) square with a height of 6.9 m (20 ft). There shall be 2.4 m x 3.1 m (8 ft x 10 ft) opening on two sides through which an MAV can enter/exit. Entry is from the South and exit from the North Walls.
The MICAVs are to enter & exit the laboratory only through the entry & exit doors provided. They are not allowed to enter from top. Also the visuals are to be obtained from inside the laboratory enclosure. Information obtained from height greater than the laboratory height will not be considered for evaluation. "
-KchaB1wsmEZ6iGIeRmd.name: MICAV

-KciNBJESMx6r8Vj5nME.about:
"Manufacturing is more than just putting parts together. It's coming up with ideas, testing principles and perfecting the engineering, as well as final assembly."
- James Dyson
“DRONA-GYAN” promises to continue the legacy of bringing excitement same as the last year, but at a much grand level in this technical season of OJASS’18 a little background knowledge of the topic is mandatory, but selective instinctive actions during the event would decide the outcome. Hence, snappy decision making coupled with a meticulous approach would surely provide you an enthralling experience
-KciNBJESMx6r8Vj5nME.detail:
ROUND 1- VIRTUAL MACHINING
Objective: Choose appropriate material, feed, speed and depth of cut for obtaining good machinability.
Details:
1. Material - You will be given 8- 10 materials. Just choose the material you want to machine by HITTING AT THE STUMPS.
2. Feed- Depending on the material you choose, select the appropriate feed value via TRIGGER OF A GUN.
3. Depths of cut- Keeping in mind above factors choose the required depth of cut by a KICK OF FOCKEY( Football + Hockey).
4. Speed- Now via KEY TO SUCCESS, show your speed to choose correct key for the box.
ROUND 2 – QUIZ ROUND
Objective
Show your knowledge by answering questions related to topics from manufacturing background, G.K., aptitude.
Details:
There will be 40 objective type questions out of which
25 from manufacturing engineering.
10 from general knowledge.
5 miscellaneous questions.
ROUND 3 - MOULDINGObjective
To prepare a sand mould by using green sand, pattern and two box moulding method.
Procedure:
You need to make a mould using the available and mandatory moulding equipment’s, by the TWO BOX MOULDING method.
-KciNBJESMx6r8Vj5nME.name: Dronagyan

rule1.text:
Rules & Points System:-Round-1
The parameters have to be chosen in the specified order (i.e. M, F, D, and S).
There is an OVERALL TIME LIMIT for the completion of whole task.
There shall be ONLY TWO participants per team.
ACTIVITY CENTER (A1) - Solve the jumbled words to get a choice of two materials. Then Four attempts would be allowed to choose the required MATERIAL through the hit at the stumps (each stump corresponds to a particular material). You need to hit at any one which corresponds to the materials you got after the puzzle.
A2- After completion of first task, FOUR attempts are allowed to select the desired FEED value.
A3- FOUR SHOTS would then be allowed to choose the desired DEPTH OF CUT. You need to place the ball via hockey stick into your preferred target.
After completion of each of the above three tasks, you will have received TWO KEYS. So, by this time you basically have SIX KEYS.
A4- Your final task is to perform the SPEED task. You will have four boxes and six keys. Choose your right “KEYS TO SUCCESS” solve the puzzle within each box to reach your final destination.

rule2.text:
Rules & Points System:-Round-2
There will be 40 questions.
Each questions carries 1 marks.
The top 10 team which will get maximum score will be selected for the 3rdround (final round).

rule3.text:
Rules & Points System:-Round-3
There is an OVERALL TIME LIMIT to complete the moulding task.
Points would be given on the basis of accuracy of the mould.
Presence of irregularities or cracks would lead to loss of points.
Each team has to make use of ONLY the available resources to the best of their abilities.
After completion of moulding, there would be RAPID FIRE questions related to moulding and casting process.

-Kclw0w8SYhwa87y5w0B.detail:
The various areas tested here are all based on digital electronics.
Round 1:
1.This is a pen-paper est. Questions will test participant’s basic knowledge of electronics and digital developments around the world .
2.Every correct answer will earn the team a definite amount of virtual money.

Round 2:
1.Shortlisted candidates from round 1 shall enter this round.
2.This will be subjective test of 60 mins.
Round 3 (Manufacturing and Marketing):
1.A list of available electronic components with their prices, and a separate list of electronic circuit that can be built with those components will be provided to each team.
2.Teams has to purchase the required components using their virtual money (which they earned in round 1 & 2) and then build the any of enlisted circuit.

4.The money given to the team for a particular circuit can be anything in between the range of market price for that circuit and will depend on the robustness of the circuit.
5.A team can again buy new components and build a new circuit and sell it to earn more money.
6.At the end of 2 hours, the team with maximum virtual money in hand wins.

-KclzVQB3WsYi7_fdawG.about: Inspired by my mis-spent youth, playing snake on our Nokia Mobile, embetrix brings opportunity for you to make a snake-themed LCD project; Partly to prove that a days kids could get an Arduino to drive an LCD screen as they wanted, and partly to see if you could remember how to code, as it's been about a millennium since you wrote any.So the project connects a LCD to an Arduino Uno board - and uses "built from scratch" code to make a snake move clockwise around the edge of the screen. Apples randomly spawn in the bottom line of the LCD; the snake will grow in length when it eats one.In order to make the project slightly more interesting, we also made the decision to use custom characters to represent the snake.Hopefully this 'Intractable' will prove useful to those looking to do something a bit different with an LCD, or those trying out custom characters for the 1st time; Seasoned pros probably won't find much of interest here!
-KclzVQB3WsYi7_fdawG.detail:
Problem statement 1(exclusively for first years)
Inspired by my mis-spent youth, playing snake on our Nokia Mobile, embetrix brings opportunity for you to make a snake-themed LCD project; Partly to prove that a days kids could get an Arduino to drive an LCD screen as they wanted, and partly to see if you could remember how to code, as it's been about a millennium since you wrote any.So the project connects a LCD to an Arduino Uno board - and uses "built from scratch" code to make a snake move clockwise around the edge of the screen. Apples randomly spawn in the bottom line of the LCD; the snake will grow in length when it eats one.In order to make the project slightly more interesting, we also made the decision to use custom characters to represent the snake.Hopefully this 'Intractable' will prove useful to those looking to do something a bit different with an LCD, or those trying out custom characters for the 1st time; Seasoned pros probably won't find much of interest here!
Specifications:-
 
At least one stage of game : with a two character snake , control with four buttons (at max)which eats apples generated at random locations on LCD , and grows in length.
Display run time score of the game(in min use of pixels).
The game should terminate when snake touches its own body or walls.
At termination display a caption with score.Problem statement 2(for second and third years)
If you have a hard time reading the color bands on resistors like I do, this project is perfect for you.Don’t struggle every time you need to know the resistance of a resistor, just build an Ohm meter and measure all of your resistors. If you come up with a good way to label and organize them, you will never need to spend time guessing the difference between those tiny grey and purple bands again.The goal of the project is to make a digital multimeter using arduino to spy on the displays, to intercept and collect data, then display data as well as other things on the display
Specifications:
To configure a digital multi-meter using arduino with as many features as you can (more features, more points ;)).
It should contain LCD to display measured units.
The system should at least be able to measure current, voltage and resistance of wide range of resistors.
Every team must bring their own breadboard circuit to show the implementation of the design.
Judging criteria for all years :-
All the teams are required to make a word document which should strictly follow the below format :
1.A detailed explanation of the system with the help of a neat system-level block diagram and an operational flowchart. 
2.The effectiveness of the hardware and software (run time complexity of code) used in solving the problem statement 
3. The overall design of the system. 
4.Innovation in design of the device and the code - Example: compactness, robustness in terms of usage, unique features etc. 
5.All basic features should be implemented and only after their evaluation the extra features would be considered and assessed accordingly. in all conditions decision of the coordinators will be final.
-KclzVQB3WsYi7_fdawG.name: EMBETRIX

-Kcm1ByvxpqFsBPQX1TH.about:
"A way to free summer training"
Do you love Internet??  Yeah you do love it !!! But If someone is snooping your data!!! oh shit that's very private data so do you want to secure that ??? ok let’s suppose you have secured it but what if internet goes down…Oh No…it’s miserable!!! Can you do anything for that, tech-guy??This event challenges you to keep your network always up.!!! Let’s see if the network troubleshooting break you down or you beat down the network problem. Take this challenge and let’s see who wins!!!Netkraft is for them who are interested in the backend process of the Internet. If you have any clue what routing is, how switches work, how a packet travels in the world of internet, how we can secure our Internet Data from so called hackers, Hardware security etc. then this is the right platform for you. Netkraft provides a platform for Network enthusiasts to accomplish their interest. -Kcm3_jbXkSGL--ilVyr.detail:
The main objective is to design a water rocket that remains air borne for the maximum duration of time with an ability to land safely by means of parachute deployment. Additionally the rocket must have a cargo bay for storage of a given delicate payload of specified dimensions.

The Event will be held in two rounds:

Round 1: The Launch
The water rockets are to be launched from a Launchpad vertically .rockets would be tested for their time of flight and parachute deployment. Teams would be given two chances to launch their rockets with the help of a given standard launcher (designed for standard 2 L cold drink bottle) or they can use their own launcher.

Round 2: Touchdown
Teams who will make it to the 2nd round will be tested for the above criteria as well as they have to bring down safely a precious and delicate cargo of a dimensions 5.7cm x 4.2cm x 4.2cm , to be supplied by us.
-Kcm3_jbXkSGL--ilVyr.name: Prakshepan

-Kcm3cChPrp5CTSf1oS9.about: The challenge is to design a mechanically-powered, self-propelling vehicle which uses any of the non-conventional power sources such as compressed air or water, potential energy of a weight, elasticity of a rubber band, string or torsional springs etc. to provide the driving forces for propulsion. The use of any conventional propelling elements like battery, motor or any other commercially available power source is prohibited. Your main focus should be on speed as well as stability of the vehicle, but at the same time it should be able to cover some distance.
-Kcm3cChPrp5CTSf1oS9.detail:
PROBLEM STATEMENT:
To design a mechanically powered, self-propelling vehicle that uses any of the non-conventional power sources such as compressed air or water, potential energy of a weight, elasticity of a rubber band, string or torsional springs etc. to provide the driving forces for propulsion. The use of any conventional propelling elements like battery, motor or any other commercially available power source is prohibited. Your main focus should be on speed as well as stability of the vehicle, but at the same time it should be able to cover some distance.
VEHICLE SPECIFICATION:
Vehicle weight should not exceed 1.5kg.
The maximum allowed water is 1L. (in addition to vehicle weight)
The maximum balloon size can be 9cm (without air).
Electric motors and batteries are strictly prohibited; the vehicle should be mechanically powered.
Maximum dimension of vehicle should be 40cm*40cm*70cm.
EVENT STRUCTURE:
This event consists of three rounds:
ROUND 1(Distance Test):
The track for this round will be a simple straight track.
The teams will have to run their vehicle on the track.
The distance covered by each vehicle on the track will be measured.
Each team will have maximum two runs, of which the best will be considered.
The top 10 teams will be selected for 2nd round.
ROUND 2(Time Test):
All teams which qualify for the second round will have to run their vehicles on a track with specified distance, without hurdles.
The time taken to cover a specified track length, by each vehicle on the track will be measured.
Each team will have maximum of two runs, out of which the best will be considered.
Top 6 teams, with least time, will qualify for Final Round.
ROUND 3(Final Race):
Six teams selected in the previous round will race against each other.
Tracks for the race will be a straight track with hurdles such as sand, pebbles, etc.
Vehicles that move out of the specified tracks will be disqualified.
Winners of this round will be the winner of the event.
-Kcm3cChPrp5CTSf1oS9.name: SAMVEG

-Kcm5_cN-LADSEUKCIXH.about: This is an amazing event for physics lovers. The idea of event is based on Newton’s laws and geometry. Participants will be provided with required materials and they have to design a stable structure with maximum height, minimum base area and minimum angle of inclination and they will be judged on the basis of stability of structure and how much time the model can hold the water in it.
-Kcm5_cN-LADSEUKCIXH.detail:
1st Round –
Keep in mind the Leaning Tower of Pisa while making the structure as in this round stability of the structure will be tested. The structure with maximum height, minimum base area and minimum angle of inclination with respect to ground. The structure should be well stable without manual support. Structure must have 2 inlets and 4 outlets.
2nd Round –
In this round water would be poured into the structure through 2 inlets and later collected through 4 outlets. The flow of water should be regular through the structure. It should not be obstructed anywhere in the structure and at the joints. The team capable of holding water for longer time would be the winner only if the structure is qualified for the contest after verification by the judges. Points will be given based on their model which will satisfy the given criteria.
-Kcm5_cN-LADSEUKCIXH.name: PIPE-O-MANIA

-KcmBMVFnXaS5sfgNu_z.about: To build a structure basically from scraps and leftovers with dimensions not above 1x1x1.2  m<sup>3</sup>.It  is supposed to be a path for a ping-pong ball(no other balls allowed).
-KcmBMVFnXaS5sfgNu_z.detail:
For every second the ball stays in motion 1.5 point is awarded.
For every element used in track formation 5 point is awarded.
For every vertical loop used in track formation 8 point is awarded.
At the exit point, for every cm of horizontal distance covered by the ball before the first touch 0.5 point is awarded.
Every time the ball stops during its stay in the path 3 point will be deducted.
-KcmBMVFnXaS5sfgNu_z.name: Accelodrome

rule1.text: There should not be any mechanical or electrical equipments installed that work on their own.

rule2.text: The paths may or may not be smooth, but the ball once dropped in the path must not stop in between.

rule3.text: The ball should be released from a certain height imparting it a zero initial horizontal velocity.

rule4.text: Each team must not have more than four members.

rule5.text: Each team will be allowed to try the run 3 times , out of which the best will be taken as final.

rule6.text: The team members are advised to bring their own ping-pong ball as per the convenience of their tracks but the size of the ball must abide by the dimensions of a commonly available ping-pong ball.

-KcmYpaGsiyRmvZ6bLOf.about:
The competition requires the participants to design a RC plane (no Ready made Planes are allowed) and perform a set of manoeuvres and lifting payloads. The participants will be needed to bring their aircraft and all necessary equipment to the venue. The arena will be an open ground. Professional Pilots will be there to fly aircrafts if required. There will be three flight rounds of the competition.

1.First Round: Complete a flight of 60 seconds and safely land in the Air field.
2.Second Round: Complete multiple horizontal EIGHT (shape) and horizontal ZERO loops safely.
3.Third Round: Add extra weight to the aircraft and complete a horizontal loop followed by safe landing.

Each team would be given two trials for successful take off in each flight round.
Every team have to submit a Design report of maximum 6 pages which consist of team name, list of members, institute, aircraft’s dimensional data, material used, parts, pictures of manufacturing process & aircraft and a brief description of designing process. Send the design report at varanwaladitya@gmail.com before one week of the event.
-KcmYpaGsiyRmvZ6bLOf.detail:
Score Distribution

1.Design Report: Maximum 100 points will be given according to the content describing your aircraft clearly.
2. 1st round: Maximum 50 points will be given depending on the smoothness and stability of the flight.
3.2nd round: Flight of maximum 90 seconds in which following manoeuvres are to be presented and points will be given as per the following.

Manoeuvres Points per manoeuvres
Horizontal EIGHT 20
Horizontal ZERO 10

4.3rd round: Maximum 100 points will be given according to the following formula.

Score = 4.5xW + 40
Where W is the weight of payload in kg.

Final Score = Summation of points from all the above mentioned rounds. Final rank list will be according to this final score.

General Information

The use of 2.4 GHz radio is required for all aircraft competing in the competition. If the participants want to use any other frequency, they will have to inform the organizers in advance.
• A limited number of 2.4 GHz radios will be available with the organizers for use by the teams. Teams who do not have access to radios can inform the organizers in advance to request use of these radios.
• Metal propellers are not allowed.
• The models can have powered take-off with a landing gear or can be hand launched manually by a person standing at ground level.
• Plane should be built from scratch and not purchased models.
• A team member can’t be a part of more than one team in the competition.
• Inform through mailbefore one week if pilots is required.
• Bring your college/student Id-Card at the time of competition.
• Any of the above mentioned rules, if found violated, teams would not be allowed to participate in the competition.
-KcmYpaGsiyRmvZ6bLOf.name: Touch Down The Plane

rule1.text: Maximum of 6 members in a team

rule2.text: Members of a team may be from same college or different (UG or PG)

rule3.text: Any number of teams can participate from one college

rule4.text: Professionals are not allowed

rule5.text: Wingspan must not greater than 0.9 metre

rule6.text: •	Maximum static Thrust (N) by empty weight (N) ratio must not greater than 0.80, where empty weight is the aircraft weight without any payloads.

rule7.text: The use of IC engines is prohibited. Only electrical motors are allowed.

rule8.text: The maximum voltage between any two points on the plane should be 12.5 V at any point of time.

-KcmaBRl0FBuXalKvqlS.about: Time to gear up for the most immersive event - THE GREAT OJASS RACE. Since its debut in OJASS’14, it gained grounds of much popularity and participation among the hustle-bustle of plethora events in OJASS. The whole institute is your arena, come kill the “keeda” of adventure within you here itself.
-KcmaBRl0FBuXalKvqlS.detail:
1. The game is to be played in teams of two and each should be a part of one team only.
2. The Great Ojass race is a 2-tier contest.
• Round1 (on Ojass day1):
Teams of two will have to take a preliminary test posing questions on aptitude, puzzles, guesstimates, basic math and reasoning.
• Round2 (on Ojass day2):
6-8 shortlisted teams on the basis of performance in previous round will compete for the designed race. The team that bags maximum points enroute all the checkpoints will win.
3. How to Race: Racers in teams of two will be dropped hints leading to various checkpoints amidst the fest. Run, walk or take public transit to reach the checkpoint, perform the given task (physical or logical) and earn points along with the next hint. Decipher the maximum hints and get to the exit point at the earliest. The team which makes it first wins The Great Ojass Race.
4. Types of hints:
• Route info – The teams will know where they are headed next through hints in the form of riddle, mathematical, cipher, picture, symbol, etc.
• Detour – Teams will have provision to choose among two different tasks.
• Yield – One team will have the power to stop other team performing for a preset time.
• Roadblock – A task that can be performed by only one team member.
-KcmaBRl0FBuXalKvqlS.name: The Great Ojass Race

rule1.text: Participants must register beforehand for the race.

rule2.text: Teams shall consist of two members.

rule3.text: The participants should remain with their teammates throughout the event.

rule4.text: Teams should make sure that both members reach the checkpoints otherwise they will not be allowed to proceed.

rule5.text: The instructions on the hint/clue cards must be followed exactly during the race or they shall stand disqualified.

rule6.text: Ample amount of time will be provided to perform the task, logical or physical.

rule7.text: Participants can receive hints for puzzles or riddles in lieu of their points to checkpoint attendants.

-Kcqk3MT-BDrz1wQ0b9R.about:
"A scientist can discover a new star but he cannot make one. He would have to ask an engineer to do it for him.- "Gordon Lindsay Glegg
OJASS'18 provides you a platform to showcase the engineer inside you. Ideas can come to anyone, but it is the prerogative of engineers to translate them into concrete reality. This event is designed to test your practical construction skills. If you want to accept the challenge of a site engineer, here is the event and it comes with the opportunity to win great prizes.
-Kcqk3MT-BDrz1wQ0b9R.detail:
Problem Statement
This is an on-the-spot event. You are required to build a semi-circular arch. This must be done only with the materials and tools provided.
Procedure
You will be given a semi-circular iron frame. The arch has to be constructed on this frame using bricks and stone-chips (10 mm down) only. The construction should be completed within the stipulated time. The Arch will then be tested against concentrated transverse load.
-Kcqk3MT-BDrz1wQ0b9R.name: ARCHMADEEASE

rule1.text:
Judging Criteria
1 Time taken to build the arch.
2 Load sustained by the arch.
Score of each team will be calculated by the relation P/t, where P is the maximum load borne by the structure and t is the time taken to complete the construction. Score will not be calculated if the construction is not completed within 30 minutes or the arch fails during the construction
Rules
